text:
Is there an ability to have separate subfolders in HubSpot CMS Website pages?
For example:
EN-AU Folder
<http://domain.com/en-au/page1|domain.com/en-au/page1>...
<http://domain.com/en-au/page2|domain.com/en-au/page2>...
<http://domain.com/en-au/page3|domain.com/en-au/page3>...

EN-US Folder
<http://domain.com/en-us/page1|domain.com/en-us/page1>...
<http://domain.com/en-us/page2|domain.com/en-us/page2>...
<http://domain.com/en-us/page3|domain.com/en-us/page3>...

When you create language variations of a page, the language slug gets prefixed to languages other than the primary language. You can also add the prefix to the primary language from settings if desired.

Hi Guys, I wanted to use "regex_replace" in HubSpot editor to remove the content in a string before pipe symbol.
Can anyone help here?

Thanks for sharing <@UU4T3609E> 
I'll try it out
Thank you for reporting! This has been corrected.
Hey all, there’s been a lot of job openings and projects related to HubSpot development in the <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> channel. If you’re looking for a new role check them out.
Is there a way to pull children pages in a HubSpot website page Like how WordPress does?

If I’m understanding correctly, the site tree is probably what you’re thinking of:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/view-your-page-hierarchy-in-site-trees>

Thanks <@U7SL518D6> :pray::skin-tone-3:
I would like to create a custom module where 
I can pull children pages name, featured image in the parent page like this example page <https://inka.alykadev.com.au/landing-page/|https://inka.alykadev.com.au/landing-page/>
Is that possible?

HubSpot has released Business Unit which can handle that please refer to the article below. It requires Enterprise version though 

<https://www.HubSpot.com/business-units|https://www.HubSpot.com/business-units>

Refer to Pages section in article below
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/account/manage-brands-with-business-unit|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/account/manage-brands-with-business-unit>
Sure! Or you could use the split filter
Hi <@U3T21PDBK> do you have any example for that?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#split>
```{% set string_to_split = "my|string" %}
{% set foo = string_to_split|split('|', 1) %}
{{ foo[1] }}```
Did you ever find an answer to this?
Does anyone know if HubSpot will eventually support Bing or Twitter Ads?
